messages.content:
Help me fill out this information for an application:
This includes a Personal Statement (maximum 1000 words in length) written by you to explain the contribution that you will make to the UK digital technology sector.  The statement should be relevant and consistent to the rest of your application, including answers to the following questions and any other information you deem relevant:

Why do you want to come to the UK?
What is your planned occupation in the UK?
Which region or city of the UK are you planning to live in?
How will the UK digital technology sector benefit from your work? (Examples of this might  include the technological advances you will bring, the creation or new markets, the planned growth of a digital technology company, the activities you will take part in outside of your direct occupation.)

I am Bilal Ghalib, cofounder of Bloom.pm a social enterprise impact organization, you can get some background on Bloom here:
Bloom Company Profile
Summer 2022
Bloom is an affiliate of AltCity Impact, a non-profit organization legally registered in Lebanon in 2015.
At Bloom, we are working to leverage new methods and technologies to support skills development, entrepreneurship education, and MSME development with a focus on building inclusive and impact-driven economies.
We do this through running programs (online and hybrid) for enterprises and accelerators to make high-quality entrepreneurship support available to everyone, everywhere, and through building online training tools for teams and program managers.


We also connect entrepreneurs, investors, mentors, partners, trainers, and fellows to educate better and accelerate small to medium-sized businesses aimed at solving challenges across a variety of industries and sectors.
We run our programs through the Bloom platform, an in-house developed online platform designed for startups and entrepreneurship programs.
The Bloom Team
We are a passionate team of 20 remote people who believe in the power of entrepreneurship and know no borders. Our team is mainly located in Lebanon, Turkey, and Europe. 
Bloom Present & Past Performance

Through our online, offline, and hybrid programs, we’ve worked with thousands of individuals and over 850 teams over the last eight years, focusing on early-stage startups, small businesses, and social enterprises. 
Our teams have mobilized over $7m in next-stage funding, won prizes (national, regional, and global), and gained acceptance in top accelerators in Lebanon and worldwide. 

So far, in our Lebanon Growth Accelerator program (LGA ) alone, we have helped 50 startups create 224 jobs in total; 93 of them were full-time jobs. Women filled 45% of the jobs, and 10% were for refugees. The teams in our programs grow personally and professionally on average, moving from one developmental stage to the next in our programs. You can find more information and charts on https://bloom.pm/impact-dashboard 

As for me, I would bring my ability to conduct research, facilitate entrepreneurship programs and importantly build educational technology software to the UK and be looking for partnerships to help increase entrepreneurship, and specifically social entrepreneurship in the UK.

Personal Statement for UK Digital Technology Sector Application

Name: Bilal Ghalib
Planned Occupation: Social Entrepreneurship and Educational Technology Specialist
Region or City: London, UK

Introduction:

As the co-founder of Bloom.pm, an organization dedicated to supporting skills development, entrepreneurship education, and micro, small, and medium-sized enterprise (MSME) development with a focus on building inclusive and impact-driven economies, I am eager to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector. I believe that my background in educational technology, research, and program facilitation, combined with my passion for fostering social entrepreneurship, will enable me to make a significant impact in the UK.

Why I want to come to the UK:

The United Kingdom offers a vibrant and diverse ecosystem for social enterprise and technology, making it an ideal destination for me to expand my impact and broaden my reach. The UK's commitment to supporting startups, innovation, and social entrepreneurship, coupled with its rich history and cultural heritage, offers unparalleled opportunities for collaboration, learning, and growth. I am excited to immerse myself in this dynamic environment, build meaningful partnerships, and contribute to the UK's thriving digital technology sector.

Planned Occupation:

As a Social Entrepreneurship and Educational Technology Specialist in the UK, I plan to work on building partnerships with local organizations, educational institutions, and startups to help increase social entrepreneurship and the use of educational technology in the country. By leveraging my experience in research, program facilitation, and educational technology software development, I hope to foster new collaborations and contribute to the growth of the UK's digital technology sector
max use only 1000 words and regenerate.

Personal Statement for UK Digital Technology Sector Application

Name: Bilal Ghalib
Planned Occupation: Social Entrepreneurship and Educational Technology Specialist
Region or City: London, UK

Introduction:

As Bloom.pm's co-founder, I aim to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector by leveraging my experience in edtech, research, and program facilitation. I am passionate about fostering social entrepreneurship and believe my background will enable me to make a significant impact in the UK.

Why I want to come to the UK:

The UK's vibrant ecosystem for social enterprise and technology is ideal for expanding my impact and reach. Its commitment to supporting startups, innovation, and social entrepreneurship offers unparalleled opportunities for collaboration, learning, and growth. I am excited to immerse myself in this dynamic environment and contribute to the UK's thriving digital technology sector.

Planned Occupation:

As a Social Entrepreneurship and Edtech Specialist in the UK, I plan to build partnerships with local organizations, educational institutions, and startups to increase social entrepreneurship and the use of edtech. Leveraging my experience, I hope to foster new collaborations and contribute to the UK's digital technology sector's growth.

How the UK digital technology sector will benefit:

1. Technological advances: My expertise in edtech software development can bring new innovations to the UK, promoting cutting-edge solutions in entrepreneurship education.

2. New markets: By fostering social entrepreneurship, I can help create new markets for digital technology, driving economic growth and social impact.

3. Digital technology company growth: Building partnerships with UK-based organizations can lead to collaborations, expanding Bloom.pm's reach and contributing to the UK's digital technology

sector.

4. Activities outside direct occupation: I plan to engage in community initiatives, mentorship programs, and networking events, sharing my expertise and insights with aspiring entrepreneurs, educators, and technology professionals.

Regional Preference:

I plan to reside in London, given its reputation as a global hub for innovation, entrepreneurship, and technology. The city's diverse ecosystem offers numerous opportunities for collaboration and partnership, facilitating my mission to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector.

Conclusion:

With my background in social entrepreneurship, edtech, research, and program facilitation, I am eager to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector. By establishing partnerships, fostering innovation, and participating in community initiatives, I believe I can make a meaningful impact on the UK's social entrepreneurship landscape and strengthen its digital technology ecosystem. I am excited about the prospect of joining the UK's vibrant community and contributing to its continued growth and success.

Can you add my interest in bringing wellbeing and flourishing to the entrepreneurial ecosystem? You can include some elements from my Bio to my personal statement, attached below: It also doesn’t say anything about the activities I will do outside my direct occupation, perhaps you can say that I am interested in wellbeing at work, and digital art explorations. You can reference my ai-wayway - a robot drawing ai data project and my hope to show some art in galleries in London.

Personal Statement for UK Digital Technology Sector Application
Name: Bilal Ghalib
Planned Occupation: Social Entrepreneurship and Educational Technology Specialist
Region or City: London, UK
Introduction:
Hello, I’m Bilal, co-founder of Bloom.pm, a social enterprise accelerator registered as an NGO in Lebanon under the name Altcity Impact, and in the UK as Bloom.pm LLP. As Bloom.pm's co-founder, I aim to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector by leveraging my experience in edtech, research, and program facilitation. I intend to expand our operations for our UK based organization by supporting the entrepreneurship ecosystem within the UK through outreach to UK based partners.I am passionate about fostering social entrepreneurship and believe my background will enable me to make a significant impact in the UK.
Why I want to come to the UK:
As a newly registered organization in the UK, Bloom is looking to expand it’s operations to address the need for entrepreneurship training in the UK. I believe that the UK's vibrant ecosystem for social enterprise and technology is ideal for expanding my impact and reach. The UK has been supporting enterprise development and social enterprise development internationally and on it’s own soil I believe that the UKs mission to support startups, innovation, and social entrepreneurship offers unparalleled opportunities for collaboration, learning, and business growth. I am excited to immerse myself in this dynamic environment and be a part of the UK's thriving entrepreneurial ecosystem.
Planned Occupation:
I will continue to be acting as Bloom’s co-founder and Head of Researh while working to build our network and increase partnerships with the ecosystem in the UK. I will be looking to connect with schools, businesses and governments looking to support both enterprise development as well as intrapreneurship activities.I bring my background as a trainer for social enterprises, my technology development and research specialties as well as my ability to gather and build community. Bloom operates in 9 countries through our programs with the Institute Francais and others, my hope is to come to the UK and foster new collaborations make the UK one of the foundational countries Bloom operates in while unlocking social enterprises in the UK to create impact, jobs, and a path to a prosperous future. 
How the UK digital technology sector will benefit:
Technological advances: My expertise in edtech software development can bring new innovations to the UK, promoting cutting-edge solutions in entrepreneurship education.
New markets: By fostering social entrepreneurship, I can help create new markets for digital technology, driving economic growth and social impact.
Digital technology company growth: Building partnerships with UK-based organizations can lead to collaborations providing our expertise in custom curriculum design that includes personal growth alongside professional growth. 
Activities outside direct occupation: I plan to engage in community initiatives, mentorship programs, and networking events, sharing my expertise and insights with aspiring entrepreneurs, educators, and technology professionals.
Regional Preference:
I plan to reside in London, given its reputation as a global hub for innovation, entrepreneurship, and technology and the friends and connections I already have in the city. The city's diverse ecosystem offers numerous opportunities for collaboration and partnership.
Conclusion:
With my background in social entrepreneurship, edtech, research, and program facilitation, I am eager to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector. By establishing partnerships, fostering innovation, and participating in community initiatives, I believe I can make a meaningful impact on the UK's social entrepreneurship landscape and strengthen its digital technology ecosystem. I am excited about the prospect of joining the UK's vibrant community and contributing to its continued growth and success.

Personal Statement for UK Digital Technology Sector Application

Name: Bilal Ghalib
Planned Occupation: Social Entrepreneurship and Educational Technology Specialist
Region or City: London, UK

Introduction:

Hello, I’m Bilal, co-founder of Bloom.pm, a social enterprise accelerator registered as an NGO in Lebanon under the name Altcity Impact, and in the UK as Bloom.pm LLP. As Bloom.pm's co-founder, I aim to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector by leveraging my experience in edtech, research, and program facilitation. I intend to expand our operations for our UK-based organization by supporting the entrepreneurship ecosystem within the UK through outreach to UK-based partners. I am passionate about fostering social entrepreneurship and believe my background will enable me to make a significant impact in the UK.

Why I want to come to the UK:

As a newly registered organization in the UK, Bloom is looking to expand its operations to address the need for entrepreneurship training in the UK. I believe that the UK's vibrant ecosystem for social enterprise and technology is ideal for expanding my impact and reach. The UK has been supporting enterprise development and social enterprise development internationally and on its own soil. I believe that the UK's mission to support startups, innovation, and social entrepreneurship offers unparalleled opportunities for collaboration, learning, and business growth. I am excited to immerse myself in this dynamic environment and be a part of the UK's thriving entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Planned Occupation:

I will continue to act as Bloom’s co-founder and Head of Research while working to build our network and increase partnerships within the UK ecosystem. I will be looking to connect with schools, businesses, and governments seeking to support

both enterprise development and intrapreneurship activities. I bring my background as a trainer for social enterprises, my technology development and research specialties, as well as my ability to gather and build community. Bloom operates in nine countries through our programs with the Institut Français and others. My hope is to come to the UK and foster new collaborations, making the UK one of the foundational countries Bloom operates in while unlocking social enterprises in the UK to create impact, jobs, and a path to a prosperous future.

How the UK digital technology sector will benefit:

1. Technological advances: My expertise in edtech software development can bring new innovations to the UK, promoting cutting-edge solutions in entrepreneurship education.

2. New markets: By fostering social entrepreneurship, I can help create new markets for digital technology, driving economic growth and social impact.

3. Digital technology company growth: Building partnerships with UK-based organizations can lead to collaborations providing our expertise in custom curriculum design that includes personal growth alongside professional growth.

Activities outside direct occupation:

In addition to my work with Bloom, I am deeply interested in wellbeing at work and digital art explorations. I plan to engage in community initiatives, mentorship programs, and networking events, sharing my expertise and insights with aspiring entrepreneurs, educators, and technology professionals. As a creator of AI-Wayway, a robot drawing AI data project, I hope to exhibit my digital art in galleries across London, further contributing to the UK's vibrant creative scene.

Regional Preference:

I plan to reside in London, given its reputation as a global hub for innovation, entrepreneurship,

Personal Statement for UK Digital Technology Sector Application

Name: Bilal Ghalib
Planned Occupation: Social Entrepreneurship and Educational Technology Specialist
Region or City: London, UK

Introduction:

Hello, I’m Bilal, co-founder of Bloom.pm, a social enterprise accelerator registered as an NGO in Lebanon under the name Altcity Impact, and in the UK as Bloom.pm LLP. As Bloom.pm's co-founder, I aim to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector by leveraging my experience in edtech, research, and program facilitation. I am passionate about fostering social entrepreneurship, integrating wellbeing, and promoting flourishing within the entrepreneurial ecosystem. My background, which includes building AI-Wayway, a robot drawing AI data project, will enable me to make a significant impact in the UK.

Why I want to come to the UK:

As a newly registered organization in the UK, Bloom is looking to expand its operations to address the need for entrepreneurship training that incorporates wellbeing and personal growth. I believe that the UK's vibrant ecosystem for social enterprise, technology, and wellbeing initiatives is ideal for expanding my impact and reach. The UK's mission to support startups, innovation, and social entrepreneurship offers unparalleled opportunities for collaboration, learning, and business growth. I am excited to immerse myself in this dynamic environment and be a part of the UK's thriving entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Add elements from my bio and don't add the art element all throught: Bilal Ghalib has 18 years of experience working with social enterprises and organizations in the USA and MENA. He and David Munir Nabti came together to found Bloom in 2016 with the vision of creating positive change by promoting personal and professional development for social entrepreneurs in the Middle East and Africa. Bilal holds a Masters's degree from the Universite de Paris in Interdisciplinary Approaches to Research and Education. He applies his expertise at Bloom by conducting research and development on applied positive psychological frameworks for creating a community-oriented online startup learning environment. Furthermore, he manages team development, researches and builds organizational partnerships, and co-facilitates online accelerator programs.

Bilal is committed to continuous improvement with a focus on wellbeing. He received the Compassionate Leaders Fellowship USA/India with H.H. The Dalai Lama from 2019-2022. He advocates for wellbeing at all levels of Bloom and its programs.

Personal Statement for UK Digital Technology Sector Application

Name: Bilal Ghalib
Planned Occupation: Social Entrepreneurship and Educational Technology Specialist
Region or City: London, UK

Introduction:

Hello, I’m Bilal Ghalib, co-founder of Bloom.pm, a social enterprise accelerator registered as an NGO in Lebanon under the name Altcity Impact, and in the UK as Bloom.pm LLP. With 18 years of experience working with social enterprises and organizations in the USA and MENA, I have dedicated my career to promoting personal and professional development for social entrepreneurs. I co-founded Bloom in 2016 alongside David Munir Nabti with the vision of creating positive change in the Middle East and Africa. As an advocate for wellbeing and a recipient of the Compassionate Leaders Fellowship USA/India with H.H. The Dalai Lama from 2019-2022, I am committed to integrating wellbeing throughout my work. I aim to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector by leveraging my experience in edtech, research, and program facilitation.

Why I want to come to the UK:

As a newly registered organization in the UK, Bloom is looking to expand its operations to address the need for entrepreneurship training that incorporates wellbeing and personal growth. I believe that the UK's vibrant ecosystem for social enterprise, technology, and wellbeing initiatives is ideal for expanding my impact and reach. The UK's mission to support startups, innovation, and social entrepreneurship offers unparalleled opportunities for collaboration, learning, and business growth. I am excited to immerse myself in this dynamic environment and be a part of the UK's thriving entrepreneurial ecosystem.

Planned Occupation:

I will continue to act as Bloom’s co-founder and Head of Research while working to build our network and increase partnerships within the UK ecosystem. I will apply my expertise at Bloom by

conducting research and development on applied positive psychological frameworks for creating a community-oriented online startup learning environment. Furthermore, I will manage team development, research and build organizational partnerships, and co-facilitate online accelerator programs. My goal is to connect with schools, businesses, and governments seeking to support both enterprise development and intrapreneurship activities while integrating wellbeing at all levels of Bloom and its programs.

How the UK digital technology sector will benefit:

1. Technological advances: My expertise in edtech software development can bring new innovations to the UK, promoting cutting-edge solutions in entrepreneurship education that integrate wellbeing and personal growth.

2. New markets: By fostering social entrepreneurship with a focus on wellbeing, I can help create new markets for digital technology, driving economic growth and social impact.

3. Digital technology company growth: Building partnerships with UK-based organizations can lead to collaborations providing our expertise in custom curriculum design that incorporates wellbeing and personal growth alongside professional development.

Activities outside direct occupation:

In addition to my work with Bloom, I am deeply interested in wellbeing at work and digital art explorations. I plan to engage in community initiatives, mentorship programs, and networking events, sharing my expertise and insights with aspiring entrepreneurs, educators, and technology professionals. As a creator of AI-Wayway, a robot drawing AI data project, I hope to exhibit my digital art in galleries across London, further contributing to the UK's vibrant creative scene.

Regional Preference:

I plan to reside in London, given its reputation as a global hub for innovation, entrepreneurship, and technology. The city's diverse ecosystem offers numerous opportunities for collaboration and partnership, facilitating my mission to contribute to the UK's digital technology sector.

Conclusion:

With my background in social entrepreneurship, edtech, research, and program facilitation,
